attributes.action: Reporting cats hit by cars under the Road Traffic Act 1988
attributes.additional_details: Cats are loved pets and many owners never find out why their cat disappeared. Up to 230,000 cats are hit each year in the UK - that’s approx. 630 a day! Currently a driver does not legally have to report hitting a cat by car and so many cats are left suffering in pain until they die - only 57% said they would stop according to a survey by Carbuyer’s. This addition would also reinforce the seriousness of Section 4 (unnecessary suffering), subsection (1)(a) of the Animal Welfare Act 2006 if a driver does not act to reduce unnecessary suffering by stopping and seeking veterinary assistance.
attributes.background: Add cats to the list of animals which have to be lawfully reported to the authorities after being hit by a car.
